file_content.text: Sergeant Rossiker, reporting. We're triangulating Guardian Hold One now, sir. Please stand by.
Come on.... Yes! Got you. Sir, this is our best estimate of the entrance, within a few meters.
And I'd recommend getting inside ASAP. Our reports on that zone look like trouble.
Nothing worthwhile is ever easy.
That does not surprise me.
What kind of trouble?
The Imperials are sending in squads, sir, but they vanish off our screens. Into the Guardian Hold would be my guess.
Nothing will prevent me from reaching the First Son. Not now.
I can't let that stop me.
Looks like the Imperials are trying to barricade Guardian Hold One, sir. I'm sorry, there's nothing else I can do.
You and your men have already been very helpful, Sergeant.
You've done a fine job.
We all appreciate that, sir. Good luck.
Goodbye, Sergeant.
I understand, sir. Good luck.
If you've finished stammering pointlessly, I have work to do.
Then stop distracting me.
You're welcome, sir.
Sergeant Rossiker signing off.
Remember, sir, this is the channel to set the communication points to once you have them.
Are you in charge here, Sergeant? I need to find a bunker called "Guardian Hold One"; Corellian officials may be hiding there.
Oh? Yes, sir. Corporal--sorry, Sergeant Rossiker, Republic operations.
You said a "Guardian Hold", sir? If there's some escape route nearby, we should have been told.
It was intended to be a Republic fortress, but it's been appropriated by the enemy.
This is new information.
I was hoping you'd have some idea where to look.
So you've never heard of it.
No, sir, I don't, and it's too dangerous to send anyone scouting.
Spare me the outrage, Sergeant, you're not exactly Special Forces.
Why? You're not important.
Maybe not, sir, but someone has to relay all those important Jedi orders.
Do you have any more details on Guardian Hold One, sir? We're not a combat unit, but we do have resources.
Imperial officers have been receiving transmissions from inside that bunker.
It's been sending out orders.
So the Guardian Hold isn't entirely sealed, they're in contact with the surface? Right, right.
Any signal from inside would be scrambled, and they'll have the best equipment on the market. But our array could reconstruct it....
The officials inside would have gone to ground only a few hours ago.
It was only recently occupied.
Huh. Government officials would want to know the state of theater overhead, right?
A powerful Sith fugitive has gone to ground in that bunker.
The First Son is inside.
Someone else was allowed inside? Oh, that wasn't smart. The Guardian Hold would need to identify friend from foe.
So Guardian Hold One must be monitoring the surface. The signal's probably being scattered, but our array's pretty good....
A military-grade communications array should track the signal in short order.
Then it's a simple matter.
Ordinarily yes, we'd just link to the communication points around Capitol Square. Er, sir.
This is fascinating, but I'm in a hurry.
I'm still waiting, Sergeant.
Sergeant: Can you find the bunker or not?
Spare me the boring details.
Oh, sorry, sir. Normally we could triangulate the bunker pretty fast by linking to communication points around Capitol Square.
Those points monitor and boost comm signals. But the Imperials captured them all yesterday. No one can get near them.
The Empire has put guards on those points, I take it.
Why not?
We have a small force that could handle this.
I have some troops.
How many? Several squads have already died trying.
I have an entire reserve force to devote to this matter.
I do have an army.
Pardon me, sir, but you'll definitely need them.
I retook two Guardian Holds where the Imperials were fully entrenched; I doubt this will be a challenge.
I've handled worse today.
There's reports that the Imperial Guard are on watch, and there's Sith with them.
The Empire knows those communication points are valuable. It'll be a bloodbath.
I'll leave most of the communication points to my army, and take the rest.
My troops can help me.
All I need to know is, if we retake the communication points, can you find the bunker?
But if I get them, we're okay?
Absolutely. The signal's not so--I mean, yes, sir.
This time, an Imperial one.
I hope you're right, sir.
Some of the comm points are on rooftops. It would take too long for one person to fight up to them--even you, sir.
Have enough Esh-kha for rooftop points. You take the rest.
Sir? When you've retaken the communication points, just switch them to this channel. A few seconds will be enough.
We'll do the rest, though I'm afraid the hard part is up to you. Please be careful.
Nadia took our reserves. But we can handle rooftop points. You take the rest.
Have enough commandos for rooftop points. You take the rest.
Captain Valon waits. Could aerial strike. Last chance, no better time.
As long as he leaves the communication points intact.
Yes, but he must be careful.
An aerial strike would soften the Imperial Guard for us.
I approve. Give the order.
If Captain Valon stays in orbit, the First Son can't escape.
No, he could stop fugitives.
Let's just hope his "oath" doesn't have any First Son-sized loopholes.
Have enough droids for rooftop points. You take the rest.
